reviews.text: Always an interesting place to visit. Been here many times and it's a good place to take children on a wet and windy day. Not so large and can get busy. Parking on Madeira Drive is possible or further along towards the marina with a nice walk on the promenade. Also nearby to the pier to combine a visit.

Plenty to see here, great for kids. Took 5he grandchildren who loved being so close to all the sea life. Pity about part being closed for works, but I'm sure it will be even better when completed. Will definitely come back when done.

First time going to the sea life centre and I've got to say it wasn't what I was expecting, the pictures used to advertise it made it seem like you see one huge tank with loads of different marina life in it, instead it is loads of separate tanks, I wasn't expecting that. 

There is plenty to see and it does take a while to go around it all, so you would say it is worth going. 
At the front desk they push selling everything to you claiming it is cheaper and will be the "last chance" the back stage pass cost £3 a head which isn't expensive but for what you get, some questions not answered because they don't know full information. 
And it was a little rushed I felt! Don't waste your pennies. 

As expected the cafe is a little more exspenive comparing it to your local add an extra £1/1.5 on top of the drinks... I didn't look at the food as we had eaten before hand. 

It gets very warm in there!! 

Lastly, we have a 1 year old who is still in nappies at the moment. So of course we headed to the baby changing to find they don't even have a room but instead you have two pull down stations outside the toilet area... it might be just me, but I don't feel comfortable changing my daughter's bum in public where everyone can see her little lady parts... 

Anyways don't think I'm just complaining we had a great time there just felt we should let's outs know what we thought so they too know what they are going into.

Their large tank is currently closed as work is being carried out for the new attraction for spring.

The kids loved it anyway, only draw back is that even though we have tickets to return before end of July it takes a lot of planning as we have to travel 2 hours just to get there.

Might be good for children. But for two visiting adults it kinda sucked. I remember going as a child and thinking how amazing it was. But as an adult its pretty small and quite expensive for what youre getting. The underwater tunnel is still cool and will always be but the rest was just slightly underwhelming.

Great idea with wonderful exhibits. Small, 
but if you love toys, especially trains, then 
this is the place for you. Tourist info point. 
Enthusiastic and very dedicated staff. Easy
access. Childhood favourites relived.
Kids loved seeing all the different toys

This is a wonderful place. We saw several children who were enthralled with what was there. Lots of different toys, but a particularly good coverage of Meccano and other, lesser known, construction toys. There is also a section about specifically Brighton related items. Of course, toy trains are well represented. It doesn't look a very big space, but there is a great deal there. When visiting, be prepared to kneel down or you will miss things. Likewise, look up to the top of displays, and to more items suspended from the ceiling. Friendly people, too! This is a must, no matter how old you are.
Small museum but lots of wonderful things in there. Prices are reasonable. Kids loved it!
Mainly old railroad models. Nothing for kids as they can't touch any of the toys. Ok for older people reminiscing..

Wonderful space right in the heart of the city. 
Shows & displays spread throughout the year. 
Easy access. Surrounded by restaurants and
cafes. New membership scheme. See website
for details. Friendly staff. Toilets.
I used to go to Fabrica after school everyday. It reminds me of the entrance in the Tate modern. Stunning installations, only downside is it's not bigger!

We were highly interested in visiting but neither was there any (open?) Entrance nor any sort of information where to find it or when they're closed. A shop owner next to it also showed us where the entrance normally is so we just guessed it's closed. Couldn't really find any information anywhere. Please improve this.
Beautiful venue, well decorated. Staff were amazing. Venue is a little cold when you are not near a radiator. But it is a old church and they are not known for being warm.
Chilly and cold in church seating was rock hard and cold. Back was in agony ouch. Art exhibition was excellent thou so was Hannah

Nice venue with plenty of seating. I'm not a huge fan of the coffee, but many are! There is a fairly decent selection of food, although the prices are a little bit steep for a coffee shop. It does have a bit of a poncy feel about it though, which is a shame. The staff are generally really helpful and friendly which is good!
Good coffee. Lovely pastries including vegan. What's not to like

Usual SB friendly service. Tasty hand food. 
Great coffee and tea. Dog friendly. Outside 
seating. Easy access.
Great coffee, seats could be more comfortable!
I live nearby so here quite often. Always a very good coffee, cosy place to sit in and friendly staff. You also get a stamp for every coffee you buy and get 10th coffee for free.

Foodilic is the perfect place to go for a late lunch, "let's go out and grab some food" meeting - only £7.50 per person for a super tasty and healthy buffet! Not too busy either. Lovely little place to spend some time, and open til 8:30pm which is ideal if you want to go to a cafe but you've left it a bit late.

Wonderful experience at Foodilic North Street, the food was wonderful especially the Beef Goulash and the salads were so nice and full of flavour. The staff were so lovely and very welcoming. This my favourite place to come whenever I'm in Brighton, I highly recommend!

I usually rave about Foodilic to those I know, as nearly everything I’ve tried from here has been delicious. I recently decided to order from there and found a hair in my salad box, which was disgusting. I couldn’t finish it and hate to waste food. This is not good, especially since they have had a bit of a reputation for poor hygiene in the past - please be more careful when preparing. I’m not sure if I’ll be dining at this branch again, which is a shame, as it’s always been my favourite. :-(

Our favourite restaurant in Brighton! Such a shame the one in kings cross in London is not that good. In here you have variety of salads, hot dishes... And the juices are awesome! Friendly staff and super good price, eat as much as you can!!
Yum yum. The salads are all delicious, so is the moussaka. Love that it's all salads and healthy ! Cheap too .
Really recommend. Everything is very cheap and you get a good portion size, maybe you get more if you eat in? But the takeaway option is top. Not perfect quality, but definitely a favourite.
Very nice food. Very nice people. I would suggest they expand, in peak time it completely fills up and you need to wait for a bit. The food and price pay off so still 5 stars.
Been going here for years, always great value, good portion size & tasty food, guess I'll be going back for a few more years. Great place...

Great food, incredibly fast service, and the prices are so low for the quality. 
Make sure to get there early because it's a small place and it's in high demand. 
Would recommend!

My favorite place in Brighton! Very good prices for very authentic Japanese food. The simple meals are my absolute favorites.

Only possible downside is the cash-only policy but that is never truly a problem considering there is an ATM not 1 minute away.

I keep coming back and I enjoy it more and more each time I go.

Excellent burgers. Lots to choose from, including adding more burgers to what is frankly, an already huge single burger. Add a small chips and it'll feed you for a week. Bacon burger is my favourite. My only issue is the chips not being fries, but that's not going to put me off returning.
Always great service and brilliant quality;)
Amazing family run place. Burgers are great and the owners are really friendly.
Food was great, staff were very friendly, clean and tidy

Tasty, fresh burgers.
Great value for money.
Definitely worth it.

Food is very good. Lots of choice. Reasonable price. Good cocktail selection. Nice staff although they were understaffed and the wait for food and drinks was a bit too long. However I definitely recommend this restaurant

The food is always fantastic it can be a little bit pricey once you add it all up but it's well worth the money. The cocktails are great and the staff are friendly. Go on Tuesday for an free extra taco to get your moneys worth.

A disappointing experience...

I came to this restaurant 4 years ago and it had the best burritos and tacos I had ever tried. Because of this I came back to share it with my family and unfortunately this was now not the case. The fish tacos (delicious something says on the menu) had so much sauce you could only taste this and the burritos had soooo much spice it was impossible to eat (beef and chicken we ordered). 

We left the food untouched and the waiter asked us if we wanted it to be wrapped to take home. We replied that it was not necessary, without giving reasons, so she came back and told us she was going to wrap it anyway for us to take home. At that point we did say that we really didn't like and that was the reason we didn't eat. The reply was "Oh!"

It still makes me giggle as that is the reply of my 3 year old when he doesn't understand something.

The place seemed still quite popular but perhaps it is one of those that it is lingering on because at one point it used to be good...

There was no table available when I just popped in and the staff was very friendly and quick to help me taking a great burrito out. While waiting I noticed this place looks really fantastic and the atmosphere is fun. Staff is very helpfull to the guests and when I ate the burrito it was also good. Recommended for a tasty Mexican experience!
Nice place, I took a burrito chicken and was good and big. I had a margarita but was not the best of my life, fully charged of tequila. Service is slow.
We had a truly lovely evening here. Great cheese. Amazing charcuterie. Awesome wine. Service was just right with friendly and knowledgeable staff. Thank you!

Great little place, superb service and the best selection of cheese in town. Recommend the journey (specialty menu item pairing cheese with wine and meat) with a few friends, slowly making your way through the afternoon, educating your taste buds.

We made a trip here for our Christmas cheese, well in advance and on a relatively quiet weekday morning, and found it overall to be disorganized. We waited for 15 minutes to even be acknowledged by a member of staff. The cheese was fine, but the person helping us was new and couldn't tell us much about it. Christmas must be their busiest time but they need to look at their shop flow, queue system, pre order pickup and how they convey information about their products.
Took me a little while to be served as it was busy because it was Christmas time but it was well worth the wait. Lovely, helpful staff and really delicious cheeses. Highly recommended.

Wonderful cheeses but far too long to wait in busy times for packaged cheeses. It is often a wonderful experience to have staff spend time with you while selecting several new taste experiences, but for those just popping in to pick up a known brand already packaged, the wait is too long. Even if you have pre-ordered a sign needs to advise you to go to end of queue,or have staff just at the till.

I came to this quaint pub for some Thai food and I must say I was not disappointed. The Pork Chow Mein Noodle was amazing, with some nice vegetable garnish with some very respectable prices and lunch deals. Will be returning fairly soon!
I've eaten here twice. Both roast dinners were delicious and plentiful.  Really friendly staff.

We informed the staff of my friend’s nut allergy which they ignored and he consequently ended up in hospital. 
The staff were told, said they couldn’t guarantee anything - would’ve been great if they said that before serving the food! 
Avoid this place.

Homely and classic vibe. Excellent customer service very accommodating, professional staff. Excellent kitchen on sundays had the smokey burger perfectly seasoned packed with flavour and great value for money. Compliments to such a superb pub, my friends and I left very satisfied.
Always good. Decent beer, friendly staff, nice atmosphere.

Good pub food in one of the pods in the garden.
That was previous visit six months ago. On latest visit I found the beer good and a pleasant atmosphere with good service at the bar. My companions had good food which they enjoyed. My fish was okay but the skinny chips were overcooked. It would have been better with chunkier chips.
Ate here for Sunday roast today. There was 4 of us, we didn't book. They couldn't do enough for us. Even gave the dog a bowl of meat. Would defiantly recommend. Good job guys we will 100% be back.

The Open House is great pub with an amazing secret garden. There are plenty of tables to sit in although you will need to make a booking for busy nights. There are heaters and booths in the garden with lovely plants and decorations. People are lovely and eager to help. Plenty of food options to choose from. Good selection of beers and ales with student discounts. A real gem.

I came in here alone for a bit of dutch courage before a date but ended up sinking a couple too many because of their wonderful, heated beer garden and beer selection. Nice pub and staff. My date didn't go that well though so unfortunately I can't quite give out a full five stars. Sorry.
(Surely couldn't have been my fault)

I've been to the Open House on many occasions and found it expensive, but with a nice staff and atmosphere.

The problem is, the food you are paying for is hit and miss. On my last visit I was served what I can only describe as the worst burger I have ever seen in my life. This vegan burger tasted like nothing, with a texture like rubber. I was told this 'best seller was great with cheese all over it which I wasn't offered and find hard to believe in any case. I expected half my money back at least, instead i was poured a half pint I didn't want. Please avoid the beetroot, walnut burger, you'll regret it if you don't. 

Like I say, the food menu is hit and miss, so choose wisely.
Lush food. Good value for money the only Indian that's as good is on Lewis rd.
Amazing, more authentic style Indian. You won't find any other dishes like these, simply delicious. Great atmosphere in a very homely environment. Epic beer selection too!
We planned to go for over a year and I can’t believe we waited so long! Lovely family restaurant with authentic Indian home cooking,

Always amazing service and food. Love the welcoming atmosphere of this little Brighton gem. I've been here with big groups and we all share the dishes so I've tried every curry on the menu. I can't pick a favourite they are all too good!!

Ready made lentils 
Ready made chapaati

Think twice before you visit

Havana belongs on any foodie's "Note to Self" page during visits to Bar Harbor.  Innovative menu for vegans and meat-lovers alike (rare!) and an inviting wine list to boot.  That they remain open most of the year - even off season - adds to our delight in visiting.  Love this place.
Really lovely little restaurant with a friendly staff.  The food was very good and the beer selection decent.  Although they got both of my beer orders wrong I would definitely go back.

Excellent restaurant. Had the fish of the day and by far was the best fish I've ever had. Portion is a little small and wait times can be long, but it is what it is. A few other patrons had the tapas and they looked excellent as well. Would recommend.

Our experience at Havana is second to none. The service was incredible matched only by the food and drinks. Enrique our server was fantastic. I highly recommend the black bean soup, the empanadas and the farmhouse salad, and the Havana martini is tasty.  Thanks!!

Best paella I've ever eaten - generous helping of perfectly-cooked seafood and the saucy rice was just spot on. But everything we had was delicious anyway. The mashed potatoes with coconut that came with one of the daily specials was just... So good...

The wine list is nuts, apparently one of the largest in the region. They have the little notes in the wine menu to help you choose, and we were really happy with the bottle we had.

And of course, the service was excellent. They open at 5pm but it appears that the live music starts a little later.

Went for the buffet option which was excellent with a good selection of options. The service was excellent - very friendly but not overly attentive. Special mention to the manager who took the time to talk my daughter through the vegetarian options available as part of the buffet. Sounds minor but done in a way that didn't make her feel awkward and made sure that she was happy with the alternatives. We will be back!

The staff is amazingly friendly and funny. Very entertaining. The owner are just cute and are always more than happy to give you an advise or recommendation for food. The prices are just fine and absolutely okay. Quality of food seems to be very good. 

The environment is just modern and perfect. Something special here in Brighton and Hove. 

I specially love the entertainment: live music, karaoke.... 

We love it here and will always come back. 
The lovely and very professional British waitress is so sweet and adorable, she makes every visit special ( our secret star of the house) 

Thank you Bali Brasseri

This is an interesting place - tucked away inside a building on the seafront its a bit like an 80's hotel restaurant  (but it's not). The food is okay and reasonably priced, the service is good. Malaysian take on Indian food - nothing pretentious about this place - a good value eating establishment

What an experience! The staff are absolutely amazing, so much fun. The decor reminds you of a Las Vegas casino and the food is nice: Malaysian and European options. The signature dish is an all you can eat buffet. The bar has a lot to offer with a set cocktail menu and the ability to ask for your own.
Excellent food and service is always good. Decor used to be dated but since the refit it’s one of my favourite places. Excellent choice for vegetarians.

As silver member got free upgrade to junior suite. One of the best suites i've been to. On 11 floor with balcony to the sea and great view on the city. Breakfast is also good with big variety. Recommend.
Awesome hotel. Really clean, well laid out rooms. The staff are all friendly, professional and helpful. Breakfast is amazing and the bar serves good food throughout the day. Highly recommend!

Very good location, clean rooms, very good breakfast.. There is a cosy lobby bar with friendly staff.
Fitness room is very small and hot water gets cold sometimes..
Location wise it gets all the 5 stars. Pretty clean. Friendly staff. Decent breakfast and lovely breakfast lounge. Ideally I would want a room with a view of the Caspian.
Stayed here for 1 night new years eve. Room was comfortable and clean. Located walking distance from the mall and restaurants
